title: How to Make Beer Muffins

steps.headline: Sift the flour and salt in the mixing bowl.
Pour in enough beer to form a moist batter.
steps.description: If you don't use it all, drink what's left over. Don't over mix; that's the death of a good muffin.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into the muffin pans.
steps.description: Sprinkle the grated cheese over the top of each muffin.

steps.headline: Bake at 180ºC/350ºF for 15 to 20 minutes or until the top of the muffins are slightly golden.
Serve warm with butter.
steps.description: Or serve with a meal and use the muffins in place of bread for mopping up stew or casserole juices.

text: Sift the flour and salt in the mixing bowl. Add the sugar and stir. Pour in enough beer to form a moist batter. If you don't use it all, drink what's left over. Don't over mix; that's the death of a good muffin. Pour the batter into the muffin pans. Sprinkle the grated cheese over the top of each muffin. Bake at 180ºC/350ºF for 15 to 20 minutes or until the top of the muffins are slightly golden.  Serve warm with butter. Or serve with a meal and use the muffins in place of bread for mopping up stew or casserole juices.
